title: Calories in 100g of Blueberries
meta_description: Discover calories in 100g of blueberries, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and full nutrition breakdown with tweaks and FAQs for better understanding.
assumptions: Fresh, raw blueberries; wild or cultivated varieties averaged; no added sugars or processing.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by variety, ripeness, growing conditions, and storage; check labels for packaged products.

quick_answer.text: 100g of fresh blueberries provides about 57 kcal, mainly from carbs with good fiber content.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged foods.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp sugar to fresh berries

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of blueberries?
What are the carbs in 100g blueberries?
faqs.a: About 14.5 g total carbs, including 2.4 g fiber and 10 g sugars.

faqs.q: Are blueberries low in fat and protein?
faqs.a: Yes, only 0.3 g fat and 0.7 g protein per 100 g.

faqs.q: Do blueberries have cholesterol or sodium?
faqs.a: Negligibleâ€”0 mg cholesterol and 1 mg sodium per 100 g.

faqs.q: How do frozen blueberries compare nutritionally?
faqs.a: Similar to fresh if unsweetened; calories remain around 57 kcal per 100 g.
